text: United States Lines was the trading name of the United States Shipping Board (USSB) and the Emergency Fleet Corporation (EFC), which operated from 1921 to 1991. She was known for having among her fleet, the SS Leviathan, which for a time held the title of the World Largest Passenger Ship until the launch of the Queen Mary in 1934, the SS America (which ran aground and sank off Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands) and the SS United States, which currently holds the title of the Fastest Passenger Ship in history on the Transatlantic Route, with a speed of 38.32 Knots, the United States is currently anchored on the Delaware River at Pier 82 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. == References == == Other websites == * Passenger Lists from the United States Lines GG Archives * Baltimore Mail Line History and Ephemera at GG Archives * United States Lines (USL) History and Ephemera at GG Archives Category:Defunct shipping companies Category:1921 establishments in the United States Category:1991 disestablishments in the United States Category:Defunct companies of the United States
title: United States Lines
